You can't manifest your wings while wearing armor unless the armor is made to accommodate them, and clothing not made to accommodate your wings might be destroyed when you manifest them.

18.name: Draconic Presence
18.description: You can channel the dread presence of your dragon ancestor, causing those around you to become awestruck or frightened. As an action, you can spend 5 sorcery points to draw on this power and exude an aura of awe or fear (your choice) to a distance of 60 feet. For 1 minute or until you lose your concentration (as if you were casting a concentration spell), each hostile creature that starts its turn in this aura must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed (if you chose awe) or frightened (if you chose fear) until the aura ends.

subclasses.name: Wild Magic
subclasses.description: Chaotic magic that can surge unexpectedly

1.name: Wild Magic Surge
1.description: Your spellcasting can unleash surges of untamed magic. Once per turn, the DM can have you roll a d20 immediately after you cast a sorcerer spell of 1st level or higher. If you roll a 1, roll on the Wild Magic Surge table to create a magical effect. If that effect is a spell, it is too wild to be affected by your Metamagic, and if it normally requires concentration, it doesn't require concentration in this case; the spell lasts for its full duration.

1.name: Tides of Chaos
1.description: You can manipulate the forces of chance and chaos to gain advantage on one attack roll, ability check, or saving throw. Once you do so, you must finish a long rest before you can use this feature again. Any time before you regain the use of this feature, the DM can have you roll on the Wild Magic Surge table immediately after you cast a sorcerer spell of 1st level or higher. You then regain the use of this feature.

6.name: Bend Luck
6.description: You have the ability to twist fate using your wild magic. When another creature you can see makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, you can use your reaction and spend 2 sorcery points to roll 1d4 and apply the number rolled as a bonus or penalty (your choice) to the creature's roll. You can do so after the creature rolls but before any effects of the roll occur.

14.name: Controlled Chaos
14.description: You gain a modicum of control over the surges of your wild magic. Whenever you roll on the Wild Magic Surge table, you can roll twice and use either number.

18.name: Spell Bombardment
18.description: The harmful energy of your spells intensifies. When you roll damage for a spell and roll the highest number possible on any of the dice, choose one of those dice, roll it again and add that roll to the damage. You can use the feature only once per turn.

subclasses.name: Divine Soul
subclasses.description: Blessed with divine magic from a celestial source

1.name: Divine Magic
1.description: Your link to the divine allows you to learn spells from the cleric class. When your Spellcasting feature lets you learn or replace a sorcerer cantrip or a sorcerer spell of 1st level or higher, you can choose the new spell from the cleric spell list or the sorcerer spell list. You must otherwise obey all the restrictions for selecting the spell, and it becomes a sorcerer spell for you. In addition, choose an affinity for the source of your divine power and learn an associated spell (Good: Cure Wounds, Evil: Inflict Wounds, Law: Bless, Chaos: Bane, Neutrality: Protection from Evil and Good).

1.name: Favored by the Gods
1.description: Divine power guards your destiny. If you fail a saving throw or miss with an attack roll, you can roll 2d4 and add it to the total, possibly changing the outcome. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

6.name: Empowered Healing
6.description: The divine energy coursing through you can empower healing spells. Whenever you or an ally within 5 feet of you rolls dice to determine the number of hit points a spell restores, you can spend 1 sorcery point to reroll any number of those dice once, provided you aren't incapacitated. You can use this feature only once per turn.

14.name: Otherworldly Wings
14.description: You can use a bonus action to manifest a pair of spectral wings from your back. While the wings are present, you have a flying speed of 30 feet. The wings last until you're incapacitated, you die, or you dismiss them as a bonus action. The affinity you chose for your Divine Magic feature determines the appearance of the spectral wings: eagle wings for good or law, bat wings for evil or chaos, or dragonfly wings for neutrality.

18.name: Unearthly Recovery
18.description: You gain the ability to overcome grievous injuries. As a bonus action when you have fewer than half of your hit points remaining, you can regain a number of hit points equal to half your hit point maximum. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclasses.name: Shadow Magic
subclasses.description: Power drawn from the Shadowfell

1.name: Eyes of the Dark
1.description: You have darkvision with a range of 120 feet. When you reach 3rd level in this class, you learn the Darkness spell, which doesn't count against your number of sorcerer spells known. In addition, you can cast it by spending 2 sorcery points or by expending a spell slot. If you cast it with sorcery points, you can see through the darkness created by the spell.

1.name: Strength of the Grave
1.description: Your existence in a twilight state between life and death makes you difficult to defeat. When damage reduces you to 0 hit points, you can make a Charisma saving throw (DC 5 + the damage taken). On a success, you instead drop to 1 hit point. You can't use this feature if you are reduced to 0 hit points by radiant damage or by a critical hit.

6.name: Hound of Ill Omen
6.description: You gain the ability to call forth a howling creature of darkness to harass your foes. As a bonus action, you can spend 3 sorcery points to magically summon a hound of ill omen to target one creature you can see within 120 feet of you. The hound uses the dire wolf statistics, with some changes. It appears in an unoccupied space of your choice within 30 feet of the target. The hound can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. At the start of its turn, the hound automatically knows its target's location. While the hound is within 5 feet of the target, the target has disadvantage on saving throws against any spell you cast.

14.name: Shadow Walk
14.description: You gain the ability to step from one shadow into another. When you are in dim light or darkness, as a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space you can see that is also in dim light or darkness.

18.name: Umbral Form
18.description: You can spend 6 sorcery points as a bonus action to magically transform yourself into a shadowy form. In this form, you have resistance to all damage except force and radiant damage, and you can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. You take 5 force damage if you end your turn inside an object. You remain in this form for 1 minute. It ends early if you are incapacitated, if you die, or if you dismiss it as a bonus action.

subclasses.name: Storm Sorcery
subclasses.description: Power infused with elemental air

1.name: Wind Speaker
1.description: The arcane magic you command is infused with elemental air. You can speak, read, and write Primordial. Knowing this language allows you to understand and be understood by those who speak its dialects: Aquan, Auran, Ignan, and Terran.

1.name: Tempestuous Magic
1.description: You can use a bonus action on your turn to cause whirling gusts of elemental air to briefly surround you, immediately before or after you cast a spell of 1st level or higher. Doing so allows you to fly up to 10 feet without provoking opportunity attacks.

6.name: Heart of the Storm
6.description: You gain resistance to lightning and thunder damage. In addition, whenever you start casting a spell of 1st level or higher that deals lightning or thunder damage, stormy magic erupts from you. This eruption causes creatures of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of you to take lightning or thunder damage (choose each time this ability activates) equal to half your sorcerer level.

6.name: Storm Guide
6.description: You gain the ability to subtly control the weather around you. If it is raining, you can use an action to cause the rain to stop falling in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on you. You can end this effect as a bonus action. If it is windy, you can use a bonus action each round to choose the direction that the wind blows in a 100-foot-radius sphere centered on you.

14.name: Storm's Fury
14.description: When you are hit by a melee attack, you can use your reaction to deal lightning damage to the attacker. The damage equals your sorcerer level. The attacker must also make a Strength saving throw against your sorcerer spell save DC. On a failed save, the attacker is pushed in a straight line up to 20 feet away from you.

18.name: Wind Soul
18.description: You gain immunity to lightning and thunder damage. You also gain a magical flying speed of 60 feet. As an action, you can reduce your flying speed to 30 feet for 1 hour and choose a number of creatures within 30 feet of you equal to 3 + your Charisma modifier. The chosen creatures gain a magical flying speed of 30 feet for 1 hour.

subclasses.name: Aberrant Mind
subclasses.description: Touched by alien psionic power

1.name: Psionic Spells
1.description: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class. You can replace one psionic spell with a divination or enchantment spell from the sorcerer, warlock, or wizard spell list.

1.name: Telepathic Speech
1.description: You can form a telepathic connection between your mind and the mind of another. As a bonus action, choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. You and the chosen creature can speak telepathically with each other while the two of you are within a number of miles of each other equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 mile). The telepathic connection lasts for a number of minutes equal to your sorcerer level.

6.name: Psionic Sorcery
6.description: When you cast any spell of 1st level or higher from your Psionic Spells feature, you can cast it by expending a spell slot as normal or by spending a number of sorcery points equal to the spell's level. If you cast the spell using sorcery points, it requires no verbal or somatic components, and it requires no material components, unless they are consumed by the spell.

6.name: Psychic Defenses
6.description: You gain resistance to psychic damage, and you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

14.name: Revelation in Flesh
14.description: You can unleash the aberrant truth hidden within yourself. As a bonus action, you can spend 1 or more sorcery points to magically transform your body for 10 minutes. For each sorcery point you spend, you can gain one of the following benefits: see invisible creatures within 60 feet, gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed and can hover, gain a swimming speed equal to twice your walking speed and can breathe underwater, or become slimy and pliable so you can squeeze through spaces as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing.

18.name: Warping Implosion
18.description: You can unleash your aberrant power as a space-warping anomaly. As an action, you can teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 120 feet of you. Immediately after you disappear, each creature within 30 feet of the space you left must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 3d10 force damage and is pulled straight toward the space you left, ending in an unoccupied space as close to your former space as possible. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pulled.

subclasses.name: Clockwork Soul
subclasses.description: Connected to the plane of absolute order

1.name: Clockwork Magic
1.description: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class. You can replace one clockwork spell with an abjuration or transmutation spell from the sorcerer, warlock, or wizard spell list.

1.name: Restore Balance
1.description: Your connection to the plane of absolute order allows you to equalize chaotic moments. When a creature you can see within 60 feet of you is about to roll a d20 with advantage or disadvantage, you can use your reaction to prevent the roll from being affected by advantage and disadvantage. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus.

6.name: Bastion of Law
6.description: You can tap into the grand equation of existence to imbue a creature with a shimmering shield of order. As an action, you can expend 1 to 5 sorcery points to create a magical ward around yourself or another creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The ward lasts until you finish a long rest or until you use this feature again. The ward is represented by a number of d8s equal to the number of sorcery points spent to create it. When the warded creature takes damage, it can expend a number of those dice, roll them, and reduce the damage taken by the total rolled on those dice.

14.name: Trance of Order
14.description: You gain the ability to align your consciousness to the endless calculations of Mechanus. As a bonus action, you can enter this state for 1 minute. For the duration, attack rolls against you can't benefit from advantage, and whenever you make an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, you can treat a roll of 9 or lower on the d20 as a 10.

18.name: Clockwork Cavalcade
18.description: You summon spirits of order to expunge disorder around you. As an action, you summon the spirits in a 30-foot cube originating from you. The spirits look like constructs of your choice. The spirits are intangible and invulnerable, and they create the following effects within the cube before vanishing: the spirits restore up to 100 hit points, divided as you choose among any number of creatures of your choice in the cube; any damaged objects entirely in the cube are repaired instantly; every spell of 6th level or lower ends on creatures and objects of your choice in the cube.

subclasses.name: Planar Magic
subclasses.description: Your innate magic stems from exposure to the raw stuff of the multiverse, granting you the ability to channel the essence of different planes

1.name: Planar Attunement
1.description: You can sense planar boundaries and portals. You know when you are within 60 feet of a planar portal or when a creature near you is from another plane. You learn the Detect Evil and Good spell, which doesn't count against your number of sorcerer spells known.

1.name: Elemental Infusion
1.description: You can channel planar energy through your spells. When you cast a spell that deals damage, you can change its damage type to one of the following: acid (Gehenna), cold (Carceri), fire (Nine Hells), lightning (Limbo), necrotic (Shadowfell), psychic (Far Realm), radiant (Upper Planes), or thunder (Elemental Planes).

6.name: Planar Step
6.description: You can slip between planes. As a bonus action, you can spend 2 sorcery points to teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. When you do so, you briefly pass through the Border Ethereal. You can bring one willing creature within 5 feet of you when you teleport this way.

14.name: Planar Resilience
14.description: Your connection to the planes shields you. You have resistance to two damage types of your choice from your Elemental Infusion options. Additionally, you can't be banished or teleported against your will unless you choose to be.

18.name: Planar Conduit
18.description: You can become a living conduit to another plane. As an action, you can spend 5 sorcery points to transform for 1 minute. While transformed, you gain a flying speed of 60 feet and can hover. You have immunity to one damage type of your choice from your Elemental Infusion options, and your spells ignore resistance to that damage type. Additionally, you can cast Plane Shift once during this transformation without expending a spell slot or material components.

warlock.name: Warlock
warlock.description: A wielder of magic that is derived from a bargain with an extraplanar entity
features: Otherworldly Patron - You have struck a bargain with an otherworldly being
Pact Magic - Your arcane research and patron have given you facility with spells
Eldritch Invocations - Gain supernatural abilities granted by your patron

subclasses.name: The Fiend
subclasses.description: Patron from the lower planes of existence

1.name: Dark One's Blessing
1.description: When you reduce a hostile creature to 0 hit points, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier + your warlock level (minimum of 1).

6.name: Dark One's Own Luck
6.description: You can call on your patron to alter fate in your favor. When you make an ability check or a saving throw, you can use this feature to add a d10 to your roll. You can do so after seeing the initial roll but before any of the roll's effects occur. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

10.name: Fiendish Resilience
10.description: You can choose one damage type when you finish a short or long rest. You gain resistance to that damage type until you choose a different one with this feature. Damage from magical weapons or silver weapons ignores this resistance.

14.name: Hurl Through Hell
14.description: When you hit a creature with an attack, you can use this feature to instantly transport the target through the lower planes. The creature disappears and hurtles through a nightmare landscape. At the end of your next turn, the target returns to the space it previously occupied, or the nearest unoccupied space. If the target is not a fiend, it takes 10d10 psychic damage as it reels from its horrific experience. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclasses.name: The Archfey
subclasses.description: Patron is a lord or lady of the fey

1.name: Fey Presence
1.description: As an action, you can cause each creature in a 10-foot cube originating from you to make a Wisdom saving throw against your warlock spell save DC. The creatures that fail their saving throws are all charmed or frightened by you (your choice) until the end of your next turn. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

6.name: Misty Escape
6.description: When you take damage, you can use your reaction to turn invisible and teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You remain invisible until the start of your next turn or until you attack or cast a spell. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

10.name: Beguiling Defenses
10.description: You are immune to being charmed, and when another creature attempts to charm you, you can use your reaction to attempt to turn the charm back on that creature. The creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your warlock spell save DC or be charmed by you for 1 minute or until the creature takes any damage.

14.name: Dark Delirium
14.description: As an action, you can choose a creature you can see within 60 feet. It must make a Wisdom saving throw against your warlock spell save DC. On a failed save, it is charmed or frightened by you (your choice) for 1 minute or until your concentration is broken. The target perceives itself in an illusory realm of your creation while in this state. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclasses.name: The Great Old One
subclasses.description: Patron is an ancient, inscrutable entity

1.name: Awakened Mind
1.description: You can telepathically speak to any creature you can see within 30 feet of you. You don't need to share a language with the creature for it to understand your telepathic utterances, but the creature must be able to understand at least one language.

6.name: Entropic Ward
6.description: When a creature makes an attack roll against you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on that roll. If the attack misses you, your next attack roll against the creature has advantage if you make it before the end of your next turn. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

10.name: Thought Shield
10.description: Your thoughts can't be read by telepathy or other means unless you allow it. You also have resistance to psychic damage, and whenever a creature deals psychic damage to you, that creature takes the same amount of damage that you do.

14.name: Create Thrall
14.description: You can use your action to touch an incapacitated humanoid. That creature is then charmed by you until a Remove Curse spell is cast on it, the charmed condition is removed from it, or you use this feature again. You can communicate telepathically with the charmed creature as long as the two of you are on the same plane of existence.

subclasses.name: The Celestial
subclasses.description: Patron is a powerful being from the Upper Planes

1.name: Bonus Cantrips
1.description: You learn the Light and Sacred Flame cantrips. They count as warlock cantrips for you, but they don't count against your number of cantrips known.

1.name: Healing Light
1.description: You gain the ability to channel celestial energy to heal wounds. You have a pool of d6s that you spend to fuel this healing. The number of dice in the pool equals 1 + your warlock level. As a bonus action, you can heal one creature you can see within 60 feet of you, spending dice from the pool. The maximum number of dice you can spend at once equals your Charisma modifier (minimum of one die). Roll the dice you spend, add them together, and restore a number of hit points equal to the total. Your pool regains all expended dice when you finish a long rest.

6.name: Radiant Soul
6.description: You have resistance to radiant damage, and when you cast a spell that deals radiant or fire damage, you can add your Charisma modifier to one radiant or fire damage roll of that spell against one of its targets.

10.name: Celestial Resilience
10.description: You gain temporary hit points whenever you finish a short or long rest. These temporary hit points equal your warlock level + your Charisma modifier. Additionally, choose up to five creatures you can see at the end of the rest. Those creatures each gain temporary hit points equal to half your warlock level + your Charisma modifier.

14.name: Searing Vengeance
14.description: When you have to make a death saving throw at the start of your turn, you can instead spring back to your feet with a burst of radiant energy. You regain hit points equal to half your hit point maximum, and then you stand up if you so choose. Each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you takes radiant damage equal to 2d8 + your Charisma modifier, and is blinded until the end of the current turn. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclasses.name: The Hexblade
subclasses.description: Bound to a sentient weapon from the Shadowfell

1.name: Hexblade's Curse
1.description: As a bonus action, choose one creature you can see within 30 feet. The target is cursed for 1 minute. The curse ends early if the target dies, you die, or you are incapacitated. Until the curse ends, you gain bonus to damage rolls against the cursed target equal to your proficiency bonus, any attack roll you make against the cursed target is a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20, and if the cursed target dies, you regain hit points equal to your warlock level + your Charisma modifier. You can't use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.

1.name: Hex Warrior
1.description: You gain proficiency with medium armor, shields, and martial weapons. When you attack with a weapon you're proficient with, you can use your Charisma modifier instead of Strength or Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls.

6.name: Accursed Specter
6.description: When you slay a humanoid, you can cause its spirit to rise from its corpse as a specter. The specter gains temporary hit points equal to half your warlock level. Roll initiative for the specter, which has its own turns. It obeys your verbal commands, and it gains a special bonus to its attack rolls equal to your Charisma modifier. The specter remains in your service until the end of your next long rest, at which point it vanishes.

10.name: Armor of Hexes
10.description: If the target cursed by your Hexblade's Curse hits you with an attack roll, you can use your reaction to roll a d6. On a 4 or higher, the attack instead misses you, regardless of its roll.

14.name: Master of Hexes
14.description: You can spread your Hexblade's Curse from a slain creature to another creature. When the creature cursed by your Hexblade's Curse dies, you can apply the curse to a different creature you can see within 30 feet of you, provided you aren't incapacitated. When you apply the curse in this way, you don't regain hit points from the death of the previously cursed creature.

subclasses.name: The Fathomless
subclasses.description: Patron from the elemental plane of water or deep seas

1.name: Tentacle of the Deeps
1.description: You can magically summon a spectral tentacle that strikes at your foes. As a bonus action, you create a 10-foot-long tentacle at a point you can see within 60 feet. It lasts for 1 minute or until you use this feature to create another tentacle. When you create the tentacle, you can make a melee spell attack against one creature within 10 feet of it. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 cold damage, and its speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of your next turn. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus.

1.name: Gift of the Sea
1.description: You gain a swimming speed of 40 feet, and you can breathe underwater.

6.name: Oceanic Soul
6.description: You gain resistance to cold damage. In addition, when you are fully submerged, any creature that is also fully submerged can understand your speech, and you can understand theirs.

6.1.name: Guardian Coil
6.1.description: When you or a creature you can see takes damage while within 10 feet of the tentacle, you can use your reaction to choose one of those creatures and reduce the damage to that creature by 1d8. When you reach 10th level in this class, the damage reduced by the tentacle increases to 2d8.

10.name: Grasping Tentacles
10.description: You learn the spell Evard's Black Tentacles. It counts as a warlock spell for you, but it doesn't count against your number of spells known. You can also cast it once without using a spell slot, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Whenever you cast this spell, your patron's magic bolsters you, granting you a number of temporary hit points equal to your warlock level. Moreover, damage can't break your concentration on this spell.

14.name: Fathomless Plunge
14.description: As an action, you can magically teleport yourself and up to five other willing creatures that you can see within 30 feet of you. Amid a whirl of tentacles, you all vanish and then reappear up to 1 mile away in a body of water you've seen (pond size or larger) or within 30 feet of it. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclasses.name: The Genie
subclasses.description: Bound to a noble genie from the Elemental Planes

1.name: Genie's Vessel
1.description: Your patron gifts you a magical vessel that grants you a measure of the genie's power. The vessel is a Tiny object, and you can use it as a spellcasting focus. You can enter the vessel and remain inside as an extradimensional space. You can remain inside for a number of hours equal to twice your proficiency bonus. While inside, you can hear the area around your vessel. As a bonus action, you can eject yourself from the vessel.

1.name: Genie's Wrath
1.description: Once during each of your turns when you hit with an attack roll, you can deal extra damage equal to your proficiency bonus. The type of damage is determined by your patron: bludgeoning (dao), thunder (djinni), fire (efreeti), or cold (marid).

6.name: Elemental Gift
6.description: You gain resistance to a damage type determined by your patron's kind: bludgeoning (dao), thunder (djinni), fire (efreeti), or cold (marid). In addition, as a bonus action, you can give yourself a flying speed of 30 feet that lasts for 10 minutes. You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus.

10.name: Sanctuary Vessel
10.description: When you enter your Genie's Vessel, you can now choose up to five willing creatures that you can see within 30 feet to enter the vessel with you. As a bonus action, you can eject any number of creatures from the vessel. Anyone who remains inside when you leave exits the vessel and appears in the unoccupied spaces closest to the vessel's exterior. In addition, when you and your allies spend at least 10 minutes inside, you can take a short rest. A creature can benefit from this short rest only once in 24 hours.

14.name: Limited Wish
14.description: You entreat your patron to grant you a small wish. As an action, you can speak your desire to your Genie's Vessel, requesting the effect of one spell that is 6th level or lower and has a casting time of 1 action. The spell can be from any class's spell list, and you don't need to meet the requirements in that spell, including costly components; the spell simply takes effect. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish 1d4 long rests.

subclasses.name: The Undead
subclasses.description: Patron is a powerful undead being

1.name: Form of Dread
1.description: You manifest an aspect of your patron's dreadful power. As a bonus action, you transform for 1 minute. You gain temporary hit points equal to 1d10 + your warlock level. Once during each of your turns, when you hit a creature with an attack roll, you can force it to make a Wisdom saving throw, and if the saving throw fails, the target is frightened of you until the end of your next turn. You are immune to the frightened condition. You can transform a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus.

6.name: Grave Touched
6.description: You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe. In addition, once during each of your turns, when you hit a creature with an attack roll and deal necrotic damage to it, you can also roll one of the damage dice an additional time and add it to the damage.

10.name: Mortal Husk
10.description: Your connection to undeath and necrotic energy now saturates your body. You have resistance to necrotic damage. If you are reduced to 0 hit points, you can cause your body to explode. Each creature within 30 feet of you takes necrotic damage equal to 2d10 + your warlock level. You then revive with 1 hit point in your previous space. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish 1d4 long rests.

14.name: Spirit Projection
14.description: As an action, you can project your spirit from your body. The body you leave behind is unconscious and in a state of suspended animation. Your spirit can remain outside your body for up to 1 hour. Your spirit has your same abilities and statistics, you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, and you can move through creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. While projecting your spirit, you can cast conjuration or necromancy spells that require no material components, and when you deal necrotic damage, you also heal an amount equal to half the necrotic damage dealt.

subclasses.name: The Undying
subclasses.description: Patron teaches secrets of eternal life

1.name: Among the Dead
1.description: You learn the Spare the Dying cantrip, which counts as a warlock cantrip for you. You also have advantage on saving throws against any disease. Additionally, undead have difficulty harming you. If an undead targets you directly with an attack or a harmful spell, that creature must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature must choose a new target or forfeit targeting someone instead of you.

6.name: Defy Death
6.description: You can give yourself vitality when you cheat death or when you help someone else cheat it. You can regain hit points equal to 1d8 + your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 hit point) when you succeed on a death saving throw or when you stabilize a creature with Spare the Dying. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

10.name: Undying Nature
10.description: You can hold your breath indefinitely, and you don't require food, water, or sleep, although you still require rest to reduce exhaustion and still benefit from finishing short and long rests. In addition, you age at a slower rate. For every 10 years that pass, your body ages only 1 year, and you are immune to being magically aged.

14.name: Indestructible Life
14.description: You partake of some of the true secrets of the Undying. On your turn, you can use a bonus action to regain hit points equal to 1d8 + your warlock level. Additionally, if you put a severed body part of yours back in place when you use this feature, the part reattaches. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclasses.name: The Vestige
subclasses.description: Your patron is a vestige‚Äîa powerful entity that once existed but has been forgotten, destroyed, or erased from reality. These beings persist in the spaces between planes, granting power to those who remember them

1.name: Vestige's Memory
1.description: You can tap into the fading memories of your vestige patron. When you make an Intelligence check to recall information, you can add your Charisma modifier to the roll. Additionally, you learn the Message cantrip, which doesn't count against your number of cantrips known.

1.name: Fading Form
1.description: As a bonus action, you can become partially incorporeal for 1 minute. While incorporeal, you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks, and you can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. You take 1d10 force damage if you end your turn inside an object. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

6.name: Forgotten Presence
6.description: You can make yourself forgettable. As an action, you can force one creature you can see within 30 feet to make a Wisdom saving throw against your warlock spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature forgets you exist for 1 minute. The creature can't target you with attacks or harmful spells, and it doesn't remember any interactions with you from before you used this feature. The effect ends if you attack the creature or force it to make a saving throw. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

10.name: Echo of Power
10.description: When you cast a warlock spell of 1st level or higher, you can create an echo of the spell. At the start of your next turn, the echo recreates the spell's effect at the same location or targeting the same creature (if applicable), using the same spell level. The echo doesn't require concentration even if the original spell did. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

14.name: Become the Vestige
14.description: You can temporarily become one with your vestige patron. As an action, you transform for 1 minute. While transformed: you become invisible, you can move through solid objects and creatures, you have immunity to all damage except force and psychic, you can't cast spells or make attacks, but you can end the transformation early as a bonus action. When the transformation ends, each creature within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of you for 1 minute. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclasses.name: The Ancient Dragon
subclasses.description: Your patron is an ancient dragon of immense power, one whose hoard of knowledge rivals its hoard of gold. These primordial wyrms grant their warlocks a fraction of their draconic might

1.name: Dragon's Tongue
1.description: You can speak, read, and write Draconic. Additionally, when you make a Charisma check to interact with dragons, your proficiency bonus is doubled if it applies to the check.

1.name: Draconic Aspect
1.description: Choose a dragon type associated with your patron. You gain resistance to the damage type associated with that dragon. Additionally, when you deal damage with a warlock spell or cantrip, you can change the damage type to match your dragon's type.

6.name: Frightful Presence
6.description: You channel your patron's terrifying presence. As an action, each creature of your choice within 30 feet must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your warlock spell save DC or become frightened of you for 1 minute. A frightened creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns. Once a creature succeeds on this save, it is immune to this feature for 24 hours. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus.

10.name: Wyrm's Scales
10.description: Draconic scales emerge to protect you. While you aren't wearing armor, your AC equals 13 + your Dexterity modifier. Additionally, once per long rest when you are reduced to 0 hit points, you can choose to drop to 1 hit point instead.

14.name: Dragon Transformation
14.description: You can assume a draconic form. As an action, you transform for 1 minute. While transformed: you grow wings and gain a flying speed of 60 feet, you can use an action to breathe a 30-foot cone of your dragon type's damage, dealing 8d6 damage (Dexterity save for half), and you have immunity to your dragon type's damage. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclasses.name: The Beholder
subclasses.description: Your patron is a beholder, an aberrant creature of immense paranoia and power. Through this connection, you gain access to strange eye-based abilities

1.name: All-Seeing Eye
1.description: You can see in magical darkness out to 60 feet. Additionally, you gain proficiency in Perception if you don't already have it, and you can add your Charisma modifier to Perception checks.

1.name: Minor Eye Ray
1.description: You can project a ray of magical energy from your eye. As an action, choose one creature you can see within 60 feet. The target must succeed on a saving throw of a type you choose (Dexterity, Constitution, or Wisdom) against your warlock spell save DC or take 1d10 force damage and suffer one minor effect: its speed is reduced by 10 feet (Dex), it has disadvantage on its next attack roll (Con), or it has disadvantage on its next saving throw (Wis). The damage increases to 2d10 at 5th level, 3d10 at 11th level, and 4d10 at 17th level.

6.name: Paranoid Awareness
6.description: Your patron's paranoia bleeds into you, making you difficult to surprise or deceive. You can't be surprised while you are conscious. Additionally, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

10.name: Eye Stalks
10.description: Spectral eye stalks manifest around you briefly when you need them. When you cast a warlock spell of 1st level or higher, you can use a bonus action to also use your Minor Eye Ray feature against a different target.

14.name: Antimagic Gaze
14.description: You can project an antimagic cone from your eye. As an action, you create a 60-foot cone of antimagic originating from you. For the duration, no spell or magical effect functions within this cone. The cone lasts until the start of your next turn. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

wizard.name: Wizard
wizard.description: A scholarly magic-user capable of manipulating the structures of reality
features: Spellcasting - You can cast wizard spells using Intelligence as your spellcasting ability
Arcane Recovery - Once per day during a short rest, you can recover expended spell slots

subclasses.name: School of Abjuration
subclasses.description: Specialist in protective magic and warding

2.name: Abjuration Savant
2.description: Gold and time to copy abjuration spells into your spellbook is halved.

2.name: Arcane Ward
2.description: When you cast an abjuration spell of 1st level or higher, you create a magical ward with HP equal to twice your wizard level + Intelligence modifier. When you take damage, the ward takes the damage instead. When you cast an abjuration spell, the ward regains HP equal to twice the spell's level.

6.name: Projected Ward
6.description: When a creature you can see within 30 feet takes damage, you can use your reaction to have your Arcane Ward absorb that damage. If the ward has 0 HP, you take any remaining damage.

10.name: Improved Abjuration
10.description: When you cast an abjuration spell requiring an ability check (like counterspell or dispel magic), you add your proficiency bonus to that check.

14.name: Spell Resistance
14.description: You have advantage on saving throws against spells, and you have resistance to damage from spells.

subclasses.name: School of Conjuration
subclasses.description: Master of summoning and teleportation magic

2.name: Conjuration Savant
2.description: Gold and time to copy conjuration spells into your spellbook is halved.

2.name: Minor Conjuration
2.description: As an action, you conjure an inanimate object in your hand or on the ground. The object is no larger than 3 feet on a side and weighs no more than 10 pounds. It is visibly magical and lasts for 1 hour or until it deals or takes damage.

6.name: Benign Transposition
6.description: As an action, you teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space, or swap places with a willing Small or Medium creature within 30 feet. Once used, you can't use this again until you finish a long rest or cast a conjuration spell of 1st level or higher.

10.name: Focused Conjuration
10.description: While concentrating on a conjuration spell, your concentration can't be broken by taking damage.

14.name: Durable Summons
14.description: Creatures you summon or create with a conjuration spell have 30 temporary hit points.

subclasses.name: School of Divination
subclasses.description: Seer who peers into the past, present, and future

2.name: Divination Savant
2.description: Gold and time to copy divination spells into your spellbook is halved.

2.name: Portent
2.description: When you finish a long rest, roll two d20s and record the numbers. You can replace any attack roll, saving throw, or ability check made by you or a creature you can see with one of these rolls. Each roll can only be used once.

6.name: Expert Divination
6.description: When you cast a divination spell of 2nd level or higher using a spell slot, you regain one expended spell slot of a level lower than the spell you cast (maximum 5th level).

10.name: The Third Eye
10.description: As an action, choose one: see 60 feet in darkness (including magical), see invisible creatures within 10 feet, read any language, or see into the Ethereal Plane up to 60 feet. Lasts until you finish a short or long rest.

14.name: Greater Portent
14.description: You roll three d20s for your Portent feature instead of two.

subclasses.name: School of Enchantment
subclasses.description: Master of charms and mind-affecting magic

2.name: Enchantment Savant
2.description: Gold and time to copy enchantment spells into your spellbook is halved.

2.name: Hypnotic Gaze
2.description: As an action, choose one creature within 5 feet. If it can see or hear you, it must make a Wisdom save or be charmed until the end of your next turn. The charmed creature is incapacitated and visibly dazed. You can use your action to maintain this effect, extending the duration. The effect ends if you move more than 5 feet away or if the creature takes damage.

6.name: Instinctive Charm
6.description: When a creature within 30 feet attacks you, you can use your reaction to divert the attack if another creature is within the attack's range. The attacker must make a Wisdom save; on a failure, they attack the closest creature other than you. Creatures immune to charm are immune to this. Once used, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

10.name: Split Enchantment
10.description: When you cast an enchantment spell of 1st level or higher that targets only one creature, you can have it target a second creature.

14.name: Alter Memories
14.description: When you cast an enchantment spell to charm a creature, you can make one creature fail its save automatically. Additionally, when the charm ends, the charmed creature has no memory of being charmed if you spend 1 minute talking to it. You can also make it forget up to 1 + Charisma modifier hours of time (minimum 1).

subclasses.name: School of Evocation
subclasses.description: Master of powerful elemental and combat magic

2.name: Evocation Savant
2.description: Gold and time to copy evocation spells into your spellbook is halved.

2.name: Sculpt Spells
2.description: When you cast an evocation spell that affects other creatures, you can choose a number of them equal to 1 + the spell's level. Those creatures automatically succeed on their saves and take no damage if they would normally take half damage on a successful save.

6.name: Potent Cantrip
6.description: When a creature succeeds on a saving throw against your cantrip, the creature takes half the cantrip's damage (if any) but suffers no additional effect.

10.name: Empowered Evocation
10.description: You add your Intelligence modifier to one damage roll of any wizard evocation spell you cast.

14.name: Overchannel
14.description: When you cast a wizard spell of 1st through 5th level that deals damage, you can deal maximum damage with that spell. If you use this feature again before a long rest, you take 2d12 necrotic damage per spell level immediately after casting. Each additional use before a long rest increases the damage by 1d12 per spell level.

subclasses.name: School of Illusion
subclasses.description: Master of deception, misdirection, and phantasms

2.name: Illusion Savant
2.description: Gold and time to copy illusion spells into your spellbook is halved.

2.name: Improved Minor Illusion
2.description: You learn the minor illusion cantrip. When you cast it, you can create both a sound and an image with a single casting.

6.name: Malleable Illusions
6.description: When you cast an illusion spell with a duration of 1 minute or longer, you can use your action to change the nature of that illusion (within the spell's normal parameters), provided you can see the illusion.

10.name: Illusory Self
10.description: When a creature makes an attack roll against you, you can use your reaction to create an illusory duplicate. The attack automatically misses, then the illusion dissipates. Once used, you can't use this again until you finish a short or long rest.

14.name: Illusory Reality
14.description: When you cast an illusion spell of 1st level or higher, you can choose one inanimate, nonmagical object that is part of the illusion and make it real for 1 minute. The object can't deal damage or directly harm anyone.

subclasses.name: School of Necromancy
subclasses.description: Master of death magic and undead servants

2.name: Necromancy Savant
2.description: Gold and time to copy necromancy spells into your spellbook is halved.

2.name: Grim Harvest
2.description: Once per turn when you kill a creature with a spell of 1st level or higher, you regain HP equal to twice the spell's level, or three times if it's a necromancy spell. You don't gain this benefit for killing constructs or undead.

6.name: Undead Thralls
6.description: You add the animate dead spell to your spellbook. When you cast animate dead, you can target one additional corpse or pile of bones. Undead you create with necromancy spells have additional benefits: their HP maximum increases by your wizard level, and they add your proficiency bonus to weapon damage rolls.

10.name: Inured to Undeath
10.description: You have resistance to necrotic damage, and your HP maximum can't be reduced.

14.name: Command Undead
14.description: As an action, you can attempt to command an undead you can see within 60 feet. It makes a Charisma save. On failure, it becomes friendly to you and obeys your commands until you use this feature again. Intelligent undead (Int 8+) get advantage, and undead with Int 12+ can repeat the save every hour.

subclasses.name: School of Transmutation
subclasses.description: Master of transformative and alchemical magic

2.name: Transmutation Savant
2.description: Gold and time to copy transmutation spells into your spellbook is halved.

2.name: Minor Alchemy
2.description: You can transform one nonmagical object of wood, stone (not gem), iron, copper, or silver into a different one of those materials. For each 10 minutes, you transform up to 1 cubic foot. The transformation lasts 1 hour or until you lose concentration.

6.name: Transmuter's Stone
6.description: You create a transmuter's stone that grants one benefit to the bearer: darkvision 60 feet, +10 speed, proficiency in Constitution saves, or resistance to acid/cold/fire/lightning/thunder damage. You can change the benefit when you cast a transmutation spell of 1st level or higher.

10.name: Shapechanger
10.description: You add polymorph to your spellbook. You can cast it without expending a spell slot to transform yourself into a beast with CR 1 or lower. Once used, you can't do this again until you finish a short or long rest.

14.name: Master Transmuter
14.description: As an action, you can consume your transmuter's stone to cause one effect: transmute a 5-foot-cube nonmagical object into another nonmagical object of similar size and mass, remove all curses/diseases/poisons from a creature and restore all HP, cast raise dead without a spell slot, or reduce a willing creature's apparent age by 3d10 years (minimum 13).

subclasses.name: Bladesinging
subclasses.description: Elven tradition of combining swordplay with magic

2.name: Training in War and Song
2.description: You gain proficiency with light armor and one type of one-handed melee weapon of your choice. You also gain proficiency in the Performance skill if you don't already have it.

2.name: Bladesong
2.description: As a bonus action, you can start a Bladesong that lasts 1 minute. It ends early if you are incapacitated, don medium/heavy armor or a shield, or use two hands for a weapon attack. While active: add Int modifier to AC and Concentration saves, gain +10 walking speed, and advantage on Acrobatics checks. You can use this a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining uses on a long rest.

6.name: Extra Attack
6.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, when you take the Attack action. Moreover, you can cast one of your cantrips in place of one of those attacks.

10.name: Song of Defense
10.description: While your Bladesong is active, when you take damage, you can use your reaction to expend one spell slot and reduce that damage by 5 times the slot's level.

14.name: Song of Victory
14.description: While your Bladesong is active, you add your Intelligence modifier to melee weapon damage rolls.

subclasses.name: War Magic
subclasses.description: Blends combat prowess with magical protection

2.name: Arcane Deflection
2.description: When you are hit by an attack or fail a saving throw, you can use your reaction to gain +2 to AC against that attack or +4 to the saving throw. When you use this, you can only cast cantrips until the end of your next turn.

2.name: Tactical Wit
2.description: You add your Intelligence modifier to your initiative rolls.

6.name: Power Surge
6.description: You can store magical energy within yourself. You start with one power surge and gain another when you successfully end a spell with dispel magic or counterspell. Maximum surges equal your Int modifier (minimum 1). When you deal damage with a wizard spell, you can spend one surge to deal extra force damage equal to half your wizard level to one target.

10.name: Durable Magic
10.description: While you maintain concentration on a spell, you have +2 to AC and all saving throws.

14.name: Deflecting Shroud
14.description: When you use Arcane Deflection, you can cause magical energy to arc from you. Up to three creatures of your choice within 60 feet take force damage equal to half your wizard level.

subclasses.name: Chronurgy Magic
subclasses.description: Manipulates time and fate itself

2.name: Chronal Shift
2.description: After you or a creature you can see within 30 feet makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can use your reaction to force the creature to reroll. You choose which roll to use. You can use this twice, regaining uses on a long rest.

2.name: Temporal Awareness
2.description: You add your Intelligence modifier to your initiative rolls.

6.name: Momentary Stasis
6.description: As an action, force a Large or smaller creature within 60 feet to make a Constitution save. On failure, it is incapacitated and speed becomes 0 until the end of your next turn or until it takes damage. You can use this a number of times equal to your Int modifier, regaining uses on a long rest.

10.name: Arcane Abeyance
10.description: When you cast a spell of 4th level or lower, you can condense it into a mote (a Tiny gray bead). The mote lasts 1 hour. A creature holding it can use an action to release the spell. The spell uses your stats but is otherwise controlled by the creature. Once used, you can't create another mote until you finish a short or long rest.

14.name: Convergent Future
14.description: When you or a creature you can see within 60 feet makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can use your reaction to ignore the die roll and decide whether it succeeds or fails. After using this, you suffer one level of exhaustion that can only be removed by a long rest.

subclasses.name: Graviturgy Magic
subclasses.description: Manipulates gravity and the fundamental forces

2.name: Adjust Density
2.description: As an action, you magically alter the density of an object or creature within 30 feet that isn't being worn or carried. The creature must be Large or smaller. For 1 minute (concentration), increase or decrease the weight by up to half. A doubled creature has disadvantage on Strength checks and -10 speed; a halved creature has advantage on Strength checks, can jump twice as far, and takes 1d10 less falling damage.

6.name: Gravity Well
6.description: Whenever you cast a spell on a creature, you can move it 5 feet to an unoccupied space if it is willing, fails the spell's save, or is hit by the spell attack. The movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

10.name: Violent Attraction
10.description: When a creature within 60 feet hits with a weapon attack, you can use your reaction to increase the damage by 1d10 (same type as the weapon). Alternatively, when a creature within 60 feet is falling, you can increase the falling damage by 2d10. You can use this a number of times equal to your Int modifier, regaining uses on a long rest.

14.name: Event Horizon
14.description: As an action, choose a point within 30 feet. For 1 minute (concentration), a 30-foot sphere of difficult terrain forms. Creatures starting their turn in or entering the sphere must make a Strength save. On failure, they take 2d10 force damage and their speed becomes 0 until the start of their next turn. On success, they take half damage and every foot of movement costs 2 extra feet. You can use this once per long rest or by spending a spell slot of 3rd level or higher.

subclasses.name: Order of Scribes
subclasses.description: Awakens the sentient magic of their spellbook

2.name: Wizardly Quill
2.description: As a bonus action, you create a Tiny quill with these properties: it doesn't require ink, the time to copy a spell into your spellbook equals 2 minutes per spell level, and you can erase anything written with it as a bonus action if you can see it within 5 feet.

2.name: Awakened Spellbook
2.description: Your spellbook becomes a sentient magical object. When casting a wizard spell with a spell slot, you can temporarily replace its damage type with another type from a spell in your spellbook. You can use your spellbook as a spellcasting focus. When you cast a ritual, you can cast it in its normal casting time rather than adding 10 minutes.

6.name: Manifest Mind
6.description: As a bonus action, you conjure the mind of your spellbook as a Tiny spectral object within 60 feet. It has 60-foot darkvision and telepathy with you. You can cast wizard spells as though you were in its space. You can move it 30 feet as a bonus action. It can pass through creatures but not objects. You can use this proficiency bonus times per long rest.

10.name: Master Scrivener
10.description: When you finish a long rest, you can create one spell scroll by touching your Wizardly Quill to blank paper. The scroll contains a 1st or 2nd level spell from your spellbook. Its casting time becomes 1 action if it was longer. The scroll lasts until your next long rest. If you cast the spell from the scroll, the spell slot expended is one level lower (minimum 1st).

14.name: One with the Word
14.description: While your spellbook is on your person, you have advantage on all Arcana checks. When you take damage while your Awakened Spellbook's mind is manifested, you can use your reaction to dismiss it and prevent all of that damage. Then roll 3d6; the total equals the number of spell levels that vanish from your spellbook (starting with highest levels). If there aren't enough levels, you drop to 0 HP instead.

subclasses.name: Hedge Mage
subclasses.description: Wizards who learn their craft outside of formal academies, often in rural communities where they serve as the local magical expert, healer, and adviser

2.name: Folk Magic
2.description: You learn magical traditions passed down through generations. You learn the Druidcraft and Spare the Dying cantrips, which count as wizard cantrips for you but don't count against your number of cantrips known. Additionally, you gain proficiency in the Medicine and Nature skills if you don't already have them.

2.name: Practical Spellcasting
2.description: When you cast a wizard spell that restores hit points or removes a condition, you can add your Intelligence modifier to the amount of healing done. Additionally, the gold and time you must spend to copy a spell into your spellbook is halved if the spell is of the abjuration, divination, or transmutation school.

6.name: Community Guardian
6.description: Your protective magic extends to those around you. When you cast an abjuration spell of 1st level or higher that targets only yourself, you can have it also target one additional creature within 30 feet. At 10th level, you can target two additional creatures. At 14th level, you can target three additional creatures.

10.name: Resourceful Casting
10.description: You've learned to stretch your magical resources. When you cast a wizard spell using a spell slot, you can choose to cast it at one level lower than the slot expended (minimum 1st level). If you do, you regain a spell slot of that lower level. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

14.name: Master of the Hearth
14.description: Your protective magic reaches its peak. You can cast Warding Bond without expending a spell slot and without requiring material components. When you do so, you don't suffer the damage sharing drawback of the spell, though you still share other effects. Additionally, whenever a creature protected by your Community Guardian or Warding Bond takes damage, you can use your reaction to reduce that damage by an amount equal to your wizard level. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

artificer.name: Artificer
artificer.description: A master of magical invention, blending magic and craftsmanship
toolProficiencies: One type of artisan's tools of your choice
features: Magical Tinkering - You can imbue mundane objects with minor magical effects
Spellcasting - You can cast artificer spells using Intelligence as your spellcasting ability
Infuse Item - You can imbue mundane items with magical infusions
The Right Tool for the Job - You can create artisan's tools with 1 hour of work

subclasses.name: Alchemist
subclasses.description: Master of potions and experimental elixirs

3.name: Tool Proficiency
3.description: You gain proficiency with alchemist's supplies. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of artisan's tools of your choice.

3.name: Alchemist Spells
3.description: You always have certain spells prepared based on your artificer level. These spells count as artificer spells for you but don't count against your number of prepared spells.

3.name: Experimental Elixir
3.description: When you finish a long rest, you can magically produce one experimental elixir in an empty flask you touch. Roll on the Experimental Elixir table or choose the effect. As an action, a creature can drink the elixir or administer it. Creating an elixir requires a 1st-level spell slot. Effects: Healing (2d4+Int HP), Swiftness (+10 speed for 1 hour), Resilience (+1 AC for 10 minutes), Boldness (1d4 to attack and saves for 1 minute), Flight (10 ft flying for 10 minutes), Transformation (alter self for 10 minutes). Elixirs last until your next long rest.

5.name: Alchemical Savant
5.description: When you cast a spell using your alchemist's supplies as the spellcasting focus, you gain a bonus to one roll of the spell. That roll must restore HP or deal acid, fire, necrotic, or poison damage. The bonus equals your Intelligence modifier (minimum +1).

9.name: Restorative Reagents
9.description: You can cast Lesser Restoration without expending a spell slot, doing so a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum once). You regain all uses when you finish a long rest. Additionally, when a creature drinks an Experimental Elixir you created, the creature gains temporary HP equal to 2d6 + your Intelligence modifier.

15.name: Chemical Mastery
15.description: You have resistance to acid and poison damage, and you are immune to the poisoned condition. You can cast Greater Restoration and Heal without expending a spell slot, without having the spell prepared, and without providing the material component. Once you cast either spell with this feature, you can't cast that spell again until you finish a long rest.

subclasses.name: Armorer
subclasses.description: Magical armor specialist who becomes one with their suit

3.name: Tools of the Trade
3.description: You gain proficiency with heavy armor and smith's tools. If you already have a proficiency, you gain proficiency with another artisan's tool of your choice.

3.name: Armorer Spells
3.description: You always have certain spells prepared based on your artificer level. These count as artificer spells for you but don't count against your prepared spells.

3.name: Arcane Armor
3.description: As an action, you turn a suit of armor into Arcane Armor. It expands to cover your entire body, you can use it as a spellcasting focus, it attaches armor gauntlets, the armor can't be removed against your will, it replaces missing limbs, and you ignore Strength requirements.

3.name: Armor Model
3.description: Choose a model: Guardian (Thunder Gauntlets: melee 1d8 thunder, target has disadvantage attacking others; Defensive Field: gain temp HP equal to artificer level as bonus action, uses = proficiency bonus per long rest) or Infiltrator (Lightning Launcher: ranged 90ft 1d6 lightning, +1d6 once per turn; 5 ft walking speed boost; advantage on Stealth). You can change model on short or long rest.

5.name: Extra Attack
5.description: You can attack twice, rather than once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

9.name: Armor Modifications
9.description: Your Arcane Armor now counts as separate items for infusion purposes: armor (chest), boots, helmet, and the armor's special weapon. Each piece can bear one of your infusions, and the infusions transfer when you change armor. You can also infuse a new item with no limit to how many items you can infuse at once.

15.name: Perfected Armor
15.description: Guardian gains Perfected: when a Huge or smaller creature you can see ends its turn within 30 feet, you can use your reaction to magically force it to make a Strength save. On failure, pull it up to 30 feet toward you, and if it ends within 5 feet, deal lightning damage equal to your Intelligence modifier. Infiltrator gains Perfected: any creature that takes lightning damage from your Lightning Launcher glimmers until the start of your next turn. While glimmering, it can't benefit from invisibility, and the next attack against it has advantage.

subclasses.name: Artillerist
subclasses.description: Master of magical cannons and explosives

3.name: Tool Proficiency
3.description: You gain proficiency with woodcarver's tools. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of artisan's tools of your choice.

3.name: Artillerist Spells
3.description: You always have certain spells prepared based on your artificer level. These count as artificer spells for you but don't count against your prepared spells.

3.name: Eldritch Cannon
3.description: As an action, you create a Small or Tiny magical cannon in an unoccupied space within 5 feet. It has AC 18 and HP equal to 5√ó your artificer level. It is immune to poison and psychic damage. Choose its type when created: Flamethrower (15 ft cone, Dex save, 2d8 fire), Force Ballista (ranged attack, 2d8 force, push 5 ft), or Protector (10 ft radius, 1d8+Int temp HP). Activate as bonus action; lasts 1 hour. You can create one cannon for free per long rest; additional cannons cost a spell slot.

5.name: Arcane Firearm
5.description: Using woodcarver's tools, you turn a wand, staff, or rod into an arcane firearm, your spellcasting focus. When you cast an artificer spell through the firearm, roll a d8 and add the result to one of the spell's damage rolls.

9.name: Explosive Cannon
9.description: Your Eldritch Cannon's damage increases: Flamethrower deals 3d8 fire, Force Ballista deals 3d8 force. Additionally, as an action, you can command the cannon to detonate. Each creature within 20 feet makes a Dex save, taking 3d8 force damage on a failed save (half on success). The cannon is destroyed.

15.name: Fortified Position
15.description: You and your allies have half cover while within 10 feet of an Eldritch Cannon you created. You can now have two cannons at the same time. If you create a third, one you choose is destroyed. Activating both uses a single bonus action, and each can be a different type.

subclasses.name: Battle Smith
subclasses.description: Warrior artificer with a mechanical companion

3.name: Tool Proficiency
3.description: You gain proficiency with smith's tools. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of artisan's tools of your choice.

3.name: Battle Smith Spells
3.description: You always have certain spells prepared based on your artificer level. These count as artificer spells for you but don't count against your prepared spells.

3.name: Battle Ready
3.description: You gain proficiency with martial weapons. When you attack with a magic weapon, you can use your Intelligence modifier instead of Strength or Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls.

3.name: Steel Defender
3.description: You create a Steel Defender, a loyal construct that accompanies you. It uses your proficiency bonus, has HP equal to 5√ó your artificer level + your Int modifier + the defender's Con modifier √ó your artificer level. In combat, it shares your initiative and takes its turn immediately after yours. It can take the Dodge action on its own, but requires your bonus action to command it to take another action (Attack, Dash, Disengage, Help, or Repair - 2d8+proficiency HP healed). If it dies, you can revive it after 1 minute or create a new one during a long rest.

5.name: Extra Attack
5.description: You can attack twice, rather than once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

9.name: Arcane Jolt
9.description: Your magic strikes and your Steel Defender become more powerful. When you or your Steel Defender hits with a magic weapon attack or the defender's Force-Empowered Rend, you can channel magical energy to cause extra effects. The target takes an extra 2d6 force damage, OR one creature or object you choose within 30 feet of the target regains 2d6 hit points. You can use this a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum once) per long rest.

15.name: Improved Defender
15.description: Your Arcane Jolt damage and healing increase to 4d6. Your Steel Defender gains a +2 bonus to AC. Additionally, when your Steel Defender uses its Deflect Attack reaction, the attacker takes force damage equal to 1d4 + your Intelligence modifier.
